it was to the point for the computer simulation context writing prompt, and giving the concept to design the problem on UX, there were some bugs. improvement needed

The generation and text enhancement. I couldn't go back and forth with the brainstorming module so we could reach better ideas. I would have made the brainstorming module like a Chat so I could have a history of prebios a generated ideas and align my own thoughts more specifically with the ideas.

It's structured format and the fact it provided multiple options to choose as final question Evaluating quality and difficulty of questions A brief explanation about the solution helps evaluation process

the access to the commonly known previous problems lack of diversity in creating new questions. it was good in creating similar questions to the previously available ones in the internet, however it could not generalize well to design new  innovative but similar problems. prompt engineering
It generated very appropiate details after i gave it my initial idea Tailoring the idea, printing it out nicely The final layout of output, setting of difficulty level to filter out details
I didnt use any platform find an innovative question with good scenario -

Brainstorming module was an amazing tool integrated in the website and I liked it the most. Prompting in a way that is understandable and sufficient for the LLM to get what I mean. I think the system works fine overall and the idea behind it is very cool. I can think of no major concern and downfall for the system, but as a bonus for the system, the UI could have been more aesthetic and compatible with different screen sizes. But except this, all other aspect of the site was okay to my eyes.
I designed this question on my own and did not use the platform. Coming up with a new idea was the hardest part. Automizing the process.
the Latex making feature - Better design for the first time usage

- integration of all steps
- pdf generation
- difficulty and innovation measuring reviewing the AI. it is unreliable in sone parts.
ok coming up with idea and formatting

every thing but mostly the latex generator solve a big problem for me. also, having every step of the question design in one place is a big feature for me. generally good but AI can make hallucinations some times. adding some more layers and RAG systems to prevent the hallucination.
the biggest porblem for me in this side is the time consuming proccess and formatting works.

I love the brainstorming idea. I used LLMs a lot, but most of the times their generated ideas were somehow similar and somewhat not diverse ideas, however I mentioned in the prompts. It generated some diverse ideas, and I could chose one. Also, I liked the generation function, however, the design function did not properly expand and format the question for me, and I did not like it. - Coming up with the idea of the question
- Formatting and making the question easy to understand
- Checking the correspondence of the question to the topic
- Generating the PDF I would definitely improved the formatting functionality, as it could work better and provide better formattings, different types of formatting, expansion, shortening, stuff. Also, I would added customizations for the generating pdf functionlity.
Themes: brainstorm_support, design_refinement, formatting_effort, helpfulness_ai, latex_pdf, time_saving

Comment:
It was well defined for me. While, since the references were not defined here (I forgot what was the references for AP course), it was challenging for me to find out whether I am off topic or not. - Coming up with the idea of the question
- Mechanisms to ensure the question is engough understanble, while challenging to avoid use of LLMs in a raw approach
- Find the most appropriate template for the assignment and rephrase it. I used ChatGPT for most of the task. I may integrated the LLMs into the process in a human-in-the-loop approach.
